oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LABORATORY EXPERIMENTS ON 3-D NEARSHORE CURRENT AND A MODEL WITH MOMENTUM FLUX BY BREAKING WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Okayasu, Akio
Hara, Koji
Shibayama, Tomoya
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: breaking waves
momentum flux
nearshore current
3D current
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Laboratory experiments are performed in a wave basin to investigate the characteristics of three dimensional distribution of the nearshore current. Direction and amplitude of the nearshore current significantly change along the vertical axis and have spiral distribution. A quasi 3-D model which gives the 3-D distribution of nearshore current is proposed. Momentum flux due to the large vortexes formed on the front face of breaking waves is included in the model to evaluate the depth averaged current. The model is examined with the experimental results.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 24 (1994): Proceedings of 24th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Kobe, Japan, 1994.
